org.spongepowered.api.item.inventory

Interface ItemStack

  • All Superinterfaces:
    DataSerializable, java.io.Serializable

    public interface ItemStack
extends java.io.Serializable, DataSerializable
    Represents a stack of a specific ItemType. Supports serialization and can be compared using the comparators listed in ItemStackComparators.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getItem

        ItemType getItem()
        Gets the ItemType item type.
        Returns:
        The item type

      • getDamage

        short getDamage()
        Get the damage/durability value.
        Returns:
        The item's damage value

      • setDamage

        void setDamage(short damage)
        Set the damage/durability.
        Parameters:
        damage - The value that the damage should be set to

      • getQuantity

        int getQuantity()
        Gets the quantity of items in this stack. This may exceed the max stack size of the item, and if added to an inventory will then be divided by the max stack.
        Returns:
        Quantity of items

      • setQuantity

        void setQuantity(int quantity)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the quantity in this stack.
        Parameters:
        quantity - Quantity
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If quantity set exceeds the getMaxStackQuantity()

      • getMaxStackQuantity

        int getMaxStackQuantity()
        Get the maximum quantity per stack. By default, returns ItemType.getMaxStackQuantity(), unless a different value has been set for this specific stack.
        Returns:
        Max stack quantity

      • setMaxStackQuantity

        void setMaxStackQuantity(int quantity)
        Set the max quantity per stack. This overrides, and is entirely separate from ItemType.getMaxStackQuantity().
        Parameters:
        quantity - Max stack quantity

      • getEnchantments

        java.util.Map<Enchantment,java.lang.Integer> getEnchantments()
        Get the enchantments applied to this stack with their levels.
        Returns:
        Map of enchantments to current levels

      • isEnchanted

        boolean isEnchanted()
        Test if this stack has enchantments.
        Returns:
        Whether this stack is enchanted

      • setEnchantment

        void setEnchantment(Enchantment enchant,
                    int level)
        Set an enchantment to the given level, adding it if necessary.
        Parameters:
        enchant - Enchantment to set the level of
        level - Level to set the enchantment at

      • removeEnchantment

        void removeEnchantment(Enchantment enchant)
        Remove an enchantment from this stack.
        Parameters:
        enchant - Enchantment to remove

      • getEnchantment

        int getEnchantment(Enchantment enchant)
        Get the level of an enchantment on this stack.
        Parameters:
        enchant - The enchantment to get the level of
        Returns:
        The level of the enchantment, or -1 if the enchantment is not applied to this stack
